original: na jāto na mṛtaścaiva na rūpo nāpi rūpavān /
analyzed: na jātaḥ na mṛtaḥ ca eva na rūpaḥ na api rūpavān
translated: Not born and not dead, not form and also not having form,

original: na saṃsāre na nirvāṇe na kārastena sūcyate // //
analyzed: na saṃsāre na nirvāṇe na kāraḥ tena sūcyate  /
translated: Not in saṃsāra and not in nirvāṇa, not an action is indicated by that.
Always the destroyer of delusion, the giver of the happiness of liberation,

analyzed: mohanam sarva mārāṇām mokāraḥ tena sūcyate
translated: The deluder of all māras, the syllable mo is indicated by that.

analyzed: buddhānām uditam dhyānam buddhānām jana melakam
translated: The arising meditation of the buddhas, the gathering of people of the buddhas,

analyzed: buddha niḥkleśa saṃbuddha bukāraḥ tena sūcyate  /
translated: The buddhas, the uncontaminated, the fully enlightened, the syllable bu is indicated by that.

analyzed: dhāryate bodhisattvaiḥ sa dharmadhātu gatiḥ sadā
translated: It is always borne by the bodhisattvas, that which is the course of the dharma realm,

analyzed: dharmāṇām paramaḥ dharmaḥ dhakāraḥ tena sūcyate  /
translated: The supreme dharma of dharmas, the syllable dha is indicated by that.

original: yathā nāsti tathā nāsti yathā nāsti tathāsti yaḥ /
analyzed: yathā na asti tathā na asti yathā na asti tathā asti yaḥ
translated: As it is not, it is not; as it is not, it is so; he who is
As he speaks, so he acts, the syllable ya is indicated by that.

analyzed: pañca akṣaram idam puṇyam pavitram pāpa nāśanam
translated: This meritorious, purifying, sin-destroying hymn of five syllables,

original: ye paṭhanti divārātrau te yānti paramāṃ gatim // //
analyzed: ye paṭhanti divārātrau te yānti paramām gatim
translated: Those who recite it day and night go to the highest state.
The glorious hymn of five syllables is complete.
